resources.string: Name of the application. {{Identical|Wikipedia}}
Name of the beta version of the application. {{Identical|Wikipedia Beta}}
Name of the alpha version of the application.
Affirmative answer to a dialog box. {{Identical|Yes}}
Negative answer to a dialog box. {{Identical|No}}
Placeholder text for the search textbox
Text in navigation sidebar that when tapped leads to the History screen. {{Identical|History}}
Error message shown when network cannot be reached when loading a page
Text for button that retries page loading when tapped. {{Identical|Retry}}
Menu item text for clearing your reading history. {{Identical|Clear history}}
Clear is an imperative verb. This is an action that clears all saved pages.
Text shown when the requested page does not exist
Text in navigation sidebar that when tapped leads to the Main Page. {{Identical|Today}}
Title for dialog box asking if you want to clear your reading history.
Message for the dialog box that asks if the user wants to clear their browsing history, as well close any tabs that are open.
Text in navigation sidebar that when tapped leads to the saved pages. {{Identical|Saved page}}
Menu item (icon) in saved pages screen to update all saved pages. {{Identical|Update saved page}}
Menu item (icon) in saved pages screen to update selected saved pages. {{Identical|Update saved page}}
Prompt before updating all saved pages

Dialog title text for Share list.
The Share list contains the following menu items (localized): * Mail * Message
Title for dialog box asking if you want to clear all of your saved pages
Small toast (popup) message saying that a page is being saved for offline reading
Small toast (popup) message saying that a saved page is being refreshed
Menu item text for deleting the currently selected saved pages {{Identical|Delete}}
Small toast (popup) message saying that the selected saved pages have been deleted
Hint for textbox that searches list of items in saved pages as user types. {{Identical|Search}}
Message shown when no saved pages were found that match the user\'s query.
Text hint for the menu button used for showing the list of current tabs.
Menu item for showing list of languages in which this article is available. {{Identical|Otherlanguages}}
Menu item for saving a page for later reading. {{Identical|Save page}}
Menu item text for sharing the currently active page. Uses the build-in Android sharing functionality, so translate it the same way as the operating system does. {{Identical|Share}}
Menu item for invoking Find in page on current page plus the hint text for the Find in page control
Menu item for choosing text size and color scheme
Menu item for opening a link in the current tab. {{Identical|Open}}
Menu item for opening a link in a new tab.
Menu item for copying a link to the system clipboard for pasting later.
Menu item caption for copying text to the system clipboard for pasting later. {{Identical|Copy}}
Menu item caption for sharing text and images with other apps such as Email and Twitter. {{Identical|Share}}
Entry in nav drawer for Nearby feature {{Identical|Nearby}}
Distance to the place mentioned in the nearby page in meters. Please leave the %d as is. It represents an integer decimal number up to 999.
Distance to the place mentioned in the nearby page in kilometers. Please leave the %.2f as is. It represents a floating point number with 2 digits after the decimal point.
Small toast (popup) message on Nearby screen saying that the current location of the device was not available.
Message in footer of article indicating when the article was last updated. \'%s\' is substituted with the appropriately formatted human-readable timestamp, such as \"seven days ago\".
HTML specifying license of the Wiki and link to appropriate CC page
HTML specifying Terms of Use and CC license before saving edits
HTML specifying Terms of Use and CC license and a log link before saving edits, only when the user has not logged in. Please do not change the href=\'https://#login\' part of the message.
Title for preference in settings screen for setting which language wikipedia to use.
Placeholder text for the textbox that when typed filters list of language wikipedias from which user can pick a language to use. {{Identical|Search}}
{{Identical|Search}}
Message shown when the user requested a list of languages in which the current article is available, but the current article is not available in any other language

Message shown when the user requested a list of languages in which the current article is available, and filtered that list using a search, but their search query does not match any of the other languages the article is available in.
Menu item that shows user list of languages the current article is available in. {{Identical|Otherlanguages}}
{{Identical|Save changes}}
Text for button that retries page loading when tapped. {{Identical|Retry}}
Text for progress dialog shown when an edit save is in progress. {{Identical|Saving}}
Small toast (popup) message saying that the edit was successful
Message for dialog box specifying that an edit save had failed
Button text to retry a failed edit save. {{Identical|Retry}}
Button text to cancel retrying a failed edit save. {{Identical|Cancel}}
Message for dialog box shown to users when they click on a link in an edit preview, informing them that if they leave the edit then they may lose their changes.
Button text for choosing to leave the edit workflow when the user clicks on a link in preview. {{Identical|Leave}}
Button text for choosing to stay inside edit workflow when the user clicks on a link in preview. {{Identical|Stay}}
Menu item text for showing the Table of Contents for the current article. {{Identical|Table of contents}}
Message shown to user when no search results are found for a string
A label for the CAPTCHA screen.
A call to action to write the CAPTCHA string.
A call to action to write the CAPTCHA string.
Call to action. \"Tap\" is imperative verb, \"touch the touchscreen\".
Dialog text that asks the user if they want to refresh the saved page, so that editing would be enabled.
{{Identical|Log in}}
{{Identical|Username}}
{{Identical|Password}}
Used as label for the checkbox to mask/unmask password.
{{Identical|Log in}}
Used as window title.
A bubble that describes the in-progress action.
An error message. {{Related|Wikipedia-android-strings-login error}}
Used as error message if the specified user does not exist. {{Related|Wikipedia-android-strings-login error}}
Used as an error message if the user tries to log in using a username which is invalid. {{Identical|Invalid username}}
A bubble that appears after logging in.
Used as alert message. {{Related|Wikipedia-android-strings-login error}}
An error message. {{Related|Wikipedia-android-strings-login error}}
Used as alert message. {{Related|Wikipedia-android-strings-login error}}
{{Identical|Log out}}
Toast popup message notifying the user that they have been logged out. {{Identical|Logged out}}
Used in \"Saved pages\" page if there are no saved pages to show.
Brief explanation of what saved pages are, and their benefits.
Used in \"Browsing history\" page if there is nothing to show.
Brief explanation that there are currently no History entries to look at. Just to fill an empty screen. This usually happens when a user just deleted history entries.
Menu item text for deleting the currently selected history entries {{Identical|Delete}}

A stylized string saying \"Wikipedia\". Used before wp_tag_line if no image representation exists. Usually the first and last characters are within big tags, if this fits the Wikipedia logo in your language.
{{Identical|Username}}
{{Identical|Create account}}
Message shown to the user while a request is sent to the server to create an account and the app is awaiting the server response
Label shown inside the email text box in the account creation form, to inform the user what they have to enter into that box.
{{Identical|Repeat password}}
{{Identical|Passwords do not match}}
Used as an error message on creating a user account where the email address the user entered does not appear to be a valid email address.
Used as error message on creating a user account.
Used as an error message on creating a user account where the user\'s IP has created too many accounts already and hit the account creation throttle.
Used as error message on creating a user account where the user is trying to create an account from a blocked open proxy.
Used as an error message during account creation when the account creation failed because username that was provided is invalid.
Used as an error message during account creation when the account creation failed because the email that was provided is invalid.
Used as an error message during account creation when the account creation failed because the password that was entered is too short.
Used as an error message during account creation when the the account creation failed because the username and password provided are the same.
Used as a generic error message during account creation when a more specific error message cannot be given to the user.
Button text on Create Account screen to go \"next\" (to CAPTCHA). {{Identical|Next}}
Button text on Create Account screen to go start creating the account (may also go to a CAPTCHA screen first). {{Identical|Create account}}
Preferences general heading. {{Identical|General}}
Label for a preferences menu link to the FAQ (frequently asked questions) wiki page for the Wikipedia apps for Android and iOS.
Text for toast connoting that Wikipedia Zero status went to OFF
Extended text describing that further usage of the app may in fact incur data charges because Wikipedia Zero is off.
Searchbar hint incorporting notion that user is searching via Wikipedia Zero so it is free
Settings label for option for warning a Wikipedia Zero user if tapping on an external link
Lengthy explanation of Wikipedia Zero for settings screen
Link title for the Wikipedia Zero FAQ for the app
Settings heading for Wikipedia Zero. {{Identical|Wikipedia Zero}}
Dialog title text to inform Wikipedia Zero user that the user is about to leave the app for an external link
Dialog text to ask Wikipedia Zero user whether the user wants to continue to an external site where standard data charges may apply
Dialog button text for Wikipedia Zero user to leave the app for an external site where standard data charges may apply.
Dialog button text for Wikipedia Zero to stay in the app and thereby avoid leaving the app for an external site where standard data charges may apply. {{Identical|Stay here}}
Message of a dialog shown the first time Wikipedia Zero mode is On.
Dialog button text for Wikipedia Zero user to learn more about Wikipedia Zero at the Wikipedia Zero FAQ for the app. {{Identical|Read more}}
Dialog button text for Wikipedia Zero user to dismiss the prompt about visiting the Wikipedia Zero FAQ for the app {{Identical|Dismiss}}
Message shown to the user while the user is waiting for the preview of their edit to be shown
Text to show for link used for sending feedback about the app.
{{Identical|Random}} Shown in left navigation. Tapping it produces a random page.
Message shown in a small toast when account creation is successful. * {{msg-mw|Accountcreatedtext|message}}
Section title for privacy related settings {{Identical|Privacy}}
Title of preference that when checked enables data collection of user behavior.
Description of preference that when checked enables data collection of user behavior.
Title of preference that when checked enables automatic upload of crash reports.
Description of preference that when checked checked enables automatic upload of crash reports.
An error message, which appears after trying to save a page with blacklisted links. The single string parameter %s for this message gets substituted with the blocked domain.
Hint for textbox that searches list of items in browsing history as user types. {{Identical|Search}}
Message shown when no history items were found that match the user\'s query.
Message shown in a toast when the app encounters a link it can not process.
Message shown to users when editing a semi-protected page
Message shown to users when editing a fully protected page
Message shown to users when editing a page that is protected with a custom level of protection. %s refers to the name of the protection level. Examples include \'templateeditor\' on enwiki.
Message in dialog box telling the user that they can not edit this page because it is protected.
Title of dialog box telling the user that they can not edit this page because it is protected.
Menu item in the nav menu to go to the Settings screen. {{Identical|Settings}}
Title at the top of the Settings screen.
Summary of the preference item to show the About screen.
Summary of the preference item to show the terms of use. {{Identical|Privacy policy}}
Summary of the preference item to show the terms of use. {{Identical|Terms of use}}

URL leading to the Wikimedia Foundation privacy policy. If you can find the appropriate language specific URL of the mobile site please do so. If not feel free to keep the English one. Example for German (lang code \"de\"): https://meta.m.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?title=Privacy_policy/de Please test the URL to make sure it works.

URL leading to the Wikimedia Foundation terms of use. If you can find the appropriate language specific URL of the mobile site please do so. If not feel free to keep the English one. Example for German (lang code \"de\"): https://m.wikimediafoundation.org/wiki/Terms_of_Use/de Please test the URL to make sure it works
Heading for section that lists the libraries that have been used in the app
Heading for section that lists the people who have contributed to the app. {{Identical|Contributor}}
Heading for section that gives credit to translatewiki transators. {{Identical|Translator}}

Credit given to translatewiki translators.
{{doc-important|Please don\'t translate the link and the site title.}}
Text and link specifying that this app was developed by the Wikimedia Foundation
{{Identical|About}}
Prompt for the user to abandon any changes that were made during editing.
{{Identical|Blocked}}
Message shown in dialog box to users who are blocked from editing when they attempt to save an edit
Message shown in dialog box to users who are blocked from editing based on their IP address
Question that asks the user how they improved the article after editing
Button text to go \"next\" after the editing screen to the preview screen. {{Identical|Next}}
Button text to finish editing and save the changes. {{Identical|Save}}
Header text to show above the preview of the edited article. {{Identical|Preview}}
Clickable summary tag for fixing a typo
Clickable summary tag for fixing grammar
Clickable summary tag for adding link(s)
Clickable summary tag for a custom/other edit summary text. {{Identical|Other}}
Hint (input field placeholder) for the user to write a custom summary of edits
Text for button that finds the next occurrence of a search term. {{Identical|Find next}}
Text for button that finds the previous occurrence of a search term
Message shown when encountering network connection issues that may be corrected by simply retrying.
Label for button shown in error dialog when updating saved pages fails that lets user try again. {{Identical|Retry}}
Message for error dialog shown when updating pages fails
Title for progress dialog shown when updating saved pages
Menu item that says that the current page has been saved.
Menu item for refreshing the saved page that is currently shown. {{Identical|Refresh page}}
Message that warns the user that their edit may be unconstructive, and asks if they want to continue saving it.
Message that informs the user that their edit is not allowed, and that the user must go back and modify the edit.
Explanation of why the edit may be flagged as unconstructive: Typing in all caps, Blanking articles or Spamming, Irrelevant external links or images, Repeating characters
Explanation of why the edit was not allowed: potentially unconstructive, or potential vandalism.
Dialog title for page/article issues list. {{Identical|Page issue}}
Label for button that shows the Page issues dialog. {{Identical|Page issue}}
Label that describes text size selection {{Identical|Font size}}
Label that describes color theme selection {{Identical|Theme}}
Button label for Light color theme {{Identical|Light}}
Button label for Dark color theme {{Identical|Dark}}
Button label for showing a list of similar titles (disambiguation) for the current page
Label that gives the user a suggestion for a better search term, instead of the one that the user gave. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the suggestion.
Label at the top of the list of recent searches that the user performed.
Button hint for clearing search history; visible when in search mode.
Dialog message that asks if the user really wants to clear the search history.
Toast message shown when we try to open an external browser but none seems to be installed.
Text shown on the panel which, when tapped, displays the full infobox to the user, therefore exposing a set of information usually composed of factual and short statements.
{{Identical|More information}}
{{Identical|Close}}
Name of the Widget (as seen in the Android widget picker) that displays today\'s featured page.
Text shown inside the widget that tells the user that the link below is today\'s featured page.

Name of the Widget (as seen in the Android widget picker) for searching Wikipedia
Followed by {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-alpha update notification text}}.
Description of the app as put up on the Google Play Store

Title for notification when new alpha update is available.
Followed by {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-alpha update notification text}}.

Text for notification when new alpha update is available.
Preceded by {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-alpha update notification title}}.
Button description for the close image button. The text is mainly for screen readers. {{Identical|Close}}
Preference title for selecting whether images are loaded in pages {{Identical|Show image}}

Description of the preference for whether images are loaded, mentioning that this setting should be disabled if the user\'s internet connection is slow, or if their data plan is limited or restricted.
Title of the Read More section at the bottom of each page. {{Identical|Read more}}
Menu label for navigating to the File page for the current image being shown in the gallery.
Error message shown when the current image could not be displayed.
Activity title of license text for the libraries we use
Label for menu item to share the current image. {{Identical|Share}}
Error message shown when there was a problem with sharing the image. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the actual error message from the system.
Label for menu item to save the current image to the Media collection on the local device.
Toast message shown when the current image was saved successfully to the local device.
Message shown when an image is saved to the device.
Message inviting the user to touch the notification to view the saved image.
Error message displayed when a video fails to be played on the device.
Message shown to explain that an extra write permission is needed to save an image.
Error message when we detect that a file cannot be written to storage.

Intro text included as part of the shared text snippet, aka Tweet-a-fact. Please do not translate the \"@Wikipedia\" in the message and preserve the spaces around it, as it refers specifically to Wikipedia\'s Twitter account. This message has two parameters. Please keep the parameters exactly as in the original English message. * %1$s is the title of the page the text snippet is from. * %2$s is an HTML link to the page.
Title for a button that, when clicked, will expand the list of references or notes at the bottom of a page.
Button on share snippet preview to share as image card.
Button on share snippet preview to share as plain text.
Content description for the share a fact preview image. This string is only used for screen readers.
Content description of Creative Commons license logo icon shown before an edit is submitted.
Content description of the actual captcha image the user has to recognize to proceed.
Short name of the Fair Use license when applied to media that do not have attribution information. {{Identical|Fair use}}
Text displayed when the uploader of a media item is not known.
Text hint for the menu button used for creating a new tab.
Text hint for the button used for closing a tab.
Very short advice on how to highlight text for copying to the clipboard or sharing.
Very short advice on sharing highlighted text on social networks.
Text for a link that will open the current page in an external browser app on the device.

Advice on accessing the table of contents for a page.
\'\'\'In right-to-left languages\'\'\' (Hebrew, Arabic, etc.) write \'\'\'left\'\'\' edge and not \"right\".
Generic error message that tells the user that the server failed to complete the last request.
Generic error message that tells the user that the response from the server was not formatted correctly.
Generic error message that tells the user that an unknown error occurred.
Message displayed to the user that shows the actual error response received from the server. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the API response from the server.
Message displayed to the user that shows the actual error code received from the server. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the API error code.
Message shown after copying a link to the system clipboard.
Message shown after copying text to the system clipboard.
Button to continue to the full article from the current link preview.
Button to obtain directions to the location specified in the link preview.
Error displayed when the device does not have any apps installed that are capable of providing directions to a location.
Title of the preference for enabling or disabling link previews.
Description of the preference for enabling or disabling link previews.
Text in navigation sidebar that when tapped leads to a web page where the user may donate to Wikipedia.
Title of the dialog that pops up when the app crashes, asking user to send a report
Text asking the user to send us a crash report
In the dialog that pops up when the app crashes, text for button that doesn\'t send a crash report. {{Identical|Skip}}
In the dialog that pops up when the app crashes, text for button that prevents the pop up from being shown again and always sends a crash report.
In the dialog that pops up when the app crashes, text for button that sends a crash report once. {{Identical|Send}}
Title of the retry screen displayed when the app crashes.
Message shown to user when the app crashes allowing them to relaunch or quit the app.
Title of button user presses to relaunch the app after it crashes.
Title of button user presses to quit the app after it crashes. {{Identical|Quit}}
